com.team08storyapp

Class Story

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team08storyapp.Story
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Story
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Story is a model class representing a Chose Your Own Adventure Story. A story has the following properties:
    • Online Story Id to uniquely identify the Story from other Stories stored online.
    • OfflineStoryId to uniquely identify the Story from other Stories stored offline.
    • Title of the Story.
    • Author of the Story.
    • A list of the Story Fragments, which are the pages that make up the Story.
    • First Story Fragment Id of the first page of the Story.
    These properties are able to be accessed through the constructor or through public getters/setters.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 November 8, 2013
    Author:
    Michele Paulichuk, Alice Wu, Ana Marcu, Jarrett Toll, Jiawei Shen
    See Also:
    StoryFragment, Serialized Form

      Story(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String author)
      A constructor for creating a Story object used when initializing a sample story for testing.

     java.lang.String title,
     java.lang.String author)
        A constructor for creating a Story object used for setting up a Story for displaying to a reader or when an Author saves a Story they are writing. The following properties must be know:
        • OfflineStoryId
        • Title
        • Author
        Parameters:
        offlineStoryId - The Id used to uniquely identify the Story offline.
        title - The title of the Story.
        author - The author of the Story.

    • Method Detail

      • getOnlineStoryId

        public int getOnlineStoryId()
        This getter method gets the unique identifier used to identify the Story online.

        If the Story is an Author's creation it may not yet have this as the Author may not have published the Story to online.

        Returns:
        The onlineStoryId used to uniquely identify of the Story from online.

      • setOnlineStoryId

        public void setOnlineStoryId(int onlineStoryId)
        This setter method sets the unique identifier when the Story is published online.
        Parameters:
        onlineStoryId - The onlineStoryId to set the Story to.

      • getOfflineStoryId

        public int getOfflineStoryId()
        This getter method gets the unique identifier that the Story uses when stored locally on the phone, whether it is a downloaded Story or a Author creation.
        Returns:
        The offlineStoryId used to uniquely identify of the Story when stored offline.

      • setOfflineStoryId

        Parameters:
        offlineStoryId - The offlineStoryId to set the stored Story to.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Story story)
        This function overwrites the equal function that is provided by java. And it evaluates the equality of author title story fragments of two stories.
        Parameters:
        story - the story object that is compared to current story object
        Returns:
        a boolean value. If two objects are equal, true will be returned otherwise false will be returned
